page.title: 04Recreation in a rural area
page.content: Recreation is something which for the most part residents in this area have to travel.None of the four villages has a sporting team of any kind i.e. Cricket,football.There are no sports grounds or facilities for sport.So recreation is partaken of in each others homes in the form of social gatherings or the public meeting place in this survey,the W.I. Hall at Kilvington,where whist drives etc. take place.Many of the women in the area belong to a local W.I.There are two which meet in this area-one at Shelton meeting in a large house of one member.The ladies of Thoroton go to a W.I. at Orston.Most residents would consider their main recreation watching T.V.,travelling out of the area for all sport except fox and beagle hunting which is a popular sport here,as is fishing.
